alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Telfair; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 11:35AM EDT until April 09 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Lumber City affecting Wheeler, Telfair and Montgomery Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Lumber City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Lumber City. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15 feet, Flood Stage is reached and minor flooding begins. Water overflows into the broad swampy flood plain. Farm fields on the right bank flood. General agriculture and timber interests are affected by the flooding. In addition...water reaches the top of the boat ramp near the Highway 341 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 15.4 feet and rising slowly. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Wednesday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 04/20/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
